author: pablodecm
body:
This pull request integrates the new DeepFlavour tagger, using the library CMSSW-DNN by @riga (the required part is also included) and adds it to the standard sequences. You can find an overview of the reason and design behind this PR in [this BTV WG presentation](https://indico.cern.ch/event/654562/contributions/2665694/attachments/1495582/2326838/DeepFlavour_BTV_meeting_19072017.pdf).

### PAT vs reference training framework (latest version)
Here are some checks of compatibility of CMSSW pat-based discriminators computed using the producers develop for this PR with the output from the training framework (DeepJet) as 2D histograms for 1000 of a ttbar RelVal sample
![cmssw_pat_vs_deepjet_prob_isb](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6707437/29188279-f19ab9ae-7e12-11e7-8e6e-0298bcc9444b.png)
![cmssw_pat_vs_deepjet_prob_isc](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6707437/29188294-ff863642-7e12-11e7-9c30-00c8da5ec747.png)

You can find the results for the rest of the flavour labels [here](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/vtchq59vdt7fxy7/AADeha_G0y4Ibrf3AivJyQqqa?dl=0). The agreement is of the order of float precision level.

### PAT vs RECO comparisons (latest version)
![cmssw_pat_vs_reco_prob_isb](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6707437/29188417-4a241610-7e13-11e7-93de-532746ac0bb2.png)

MINIAOD/RECO comparisons (features can be potentially different and the model is trained with MINIAOD), early investigations showed worrying disagreement, especially given that this sequence will run on RECO by default. Latest changes reduce the disagreement.
title: Tensorflow-based integration of new DeepFlavour tagger
